intro: Brathys denticulata var. virgata, commonly known as the Virgin's Teeth, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, serrated leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
